text: We spoke this morning, we spoke about taking advantage of the gold for the simple reason that it had that triple inside day. In a nutshell, the footprint is hands down the single most important tool that I have and I think that most traders have, simply because we can ultimately pick up on nuanced shifts and that's what the footprint is for. It shows you those sudden changes. A market will only break once an initiative comes in, once a large influential participant comes in and initiates. Now you can see that initiation in one of two ways. One is the price ladder and obviously you can pick up on certain changes in the price ladder, but the other is the footprint and I'm going to show you what that change Okay, so here we have the gold footprint. This is a five-minute rotation. Note, the market went into sideways mode. Now this is so typical. This is classic, like a textbook example. Markets will always, let me rephrase, the best breakouts come when markets consolidate ahead of the break. That's a real golden rule of thumb. If you observe breakouts for a couple of years, you'll recognize the best breakouts always consolidate ahead of the break. Now, the first observation, note the lack of initiative at these lower prices. So what you can see is that every time the market came to this lower end of the day, no one wanted to be a seller, 29 by 0, 26 by 0, 68, 2 lots, no one wanted to initiate. text: one of these previous rotations, sellers would not commit to lower prices. Suddenly, what did sellers do here? Sellers committed to lower prices. How do we know? Because suddenly there was 360 lots traded at 17.2, there was another 320 lots traded at 17.1. As some total of 500 contracts traded over two prices, when previously for the last almost 40 minutes, there was a lack of commitment, a lack of initiative. And that's the key signal, that's the key takeaway. Once that came in, bang, you're in, the breakout is on, it's game time. for the initiative. And that's what we got. We got that initiative splashed down. Our entry point was quite straightforward as well, right on those 17 ones, all the way down. A good 30-35 tick move, which was lovely guys. We're talking about almost a 50% extension of the morning's range. So a lovely, fantastic, fast money move. And again, then the process of consolidation. That's the key element of the breakout. That is ultimately what we look for on the footprint to learn to trade breakouts.
